data.title: Speed up start time
data.body:
Recently noticed the start time for me was trending back to `1.5s`.

This is a PR to get it down to the normal `800ms-1000ms` I usually see.

:racehorse::racehorse::racehorse:

data.title: Bootstrap before requiring async
data.body: `async` isn't requirable until `script/bootstrap` is done so don't require it until then.

data.title: Use `~/.atom/keymap.cson` file instead of `~/atom/keymaps` directory
data.body: Using a keymap file in ~/.atom will make it more obvious how to edit keymaps. We can also document the file so users can discover how to edit keymaps without having to search through docs.

data.title: When opening a window, only use serialized buffer text if the contents on disk have not changed.
data.body:
Scenario:

There are two branches, `master` and `another-branch`. `another-branch` has modified `README.md`
1. Open Atom and modify `README.md` on the `master` branch and **don't** save it.
2. Close Atom.
3. Checkout `another-branch`
4. Open Atom.
5. Atom opens `README.md` but uses the disk contents instead of the serialized changes from the `master` branch.

Previously `README.md` would be opened as modified and contain the serialized changes from `master`. This was terribly annoying.

data.title: Cursor x position is miscalculated in certain situations
data.body:
@benogle: Is something going wrong with the caching for editors that can be created in a hidden/detached state?

![screen shot 2013-10-25 at 11 43 43 am](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1789/1410006/062d4f4a-3d9d-11e3-975b-50fb8fa440c7.png)

data.title: Windows Support
data.body:
:rotating_light: The staging area for windows support. :rotating_light: 
- [x] Get core dependencies installable
  - ~~bootstrap fails on clone~~
  - ~~git-utils builds in windows atom/git-utils#7 (enables git-utils, scandal and collaboration)~~
  - ~~pathwatcher builds in windows atom/node-pathwatcher#1 (enables pathwatcher)~~
- [x] Get dev dependencies installable
- [x] Get core packages installable
  - ~~keytar builds in windows atom/node-keytar#2 (enables github-sign-in, gists and release-notes)~~
  - ~~spellchecker builds in windows atom/node-spellchecker#1 (enables spell-check)~~
  - ~~ctags builds in windows atom/node-ctags#1 (enables symbol-view)~~
- [x] Get `language-*` packages installable
- [x] Get atom's bootstrap to complete
## Issues
- [ ] atom/apm/src/auth.coffee "security" doesn't exist on windows.
- [ ] grunt-coffeelint/node_modules/coffeelint/package.json:    "install": "[ -e lib/commandline.js ] || npm run compile", 
  You can't use bash in your install script.
- [ ] Convert backslashes to forward slashes (git icon doesn't appear in tree-view)
- [ ] Fuzzy finder doesn't load
- [ ] Crashes after several seconds when `autocomplete`, `archive-view` and `bookmarks` are loaded (but not each package independently.
## Development Environment Notes
- Install Visual C++ 2010 Express - English from Microsoft
- Install the latest node 0.10.x from http://nodejs.org, 32bit
- Install the latest python 2.7.x from http://python.org, 32 bit
- Install Github for Windows
- Add `C:\Python27;C:\Program Files\nodejs;C:\Users\IEUser\Documents\GitHub\atom\node_modules\` to your PATH
- Set ATOM_ACCESS_TOKEN to your oauth2 credentials (run `security -q find-generic-password -ws 'GitHub API Token'` on OSX to get your credentials).
- Launch Github for Windows, sign in, clone Atom.
- Use the git shell and cd into your atom checkout.
- Run `script/bootstrap`

data.title: Should sign windows executable
data.body: Once we have Atom running on windows we should sign it so users don't receive the SmartScreen warning.

data.title: Search modified buffers
data.body:
`Project::scan` will scan a buffer's contents (instead of on disk contents) if the buffer is modified.

Fixes issue #487

data.title: Fix commenting on hard tab lines
data.body:
Previously commenting on hard tabs lines with soft tabs enabled would corrupt the text being commented.

See atom/language-c#1 for deets.

data.title: Marker.getScreenRange() is empty on top-level folded row
data.body:
- Create a marker on a folded row
- `marker.getScreenRange().isEmpty()` returns true

It seems like this should return false. Note this example in find and replace:

![marker-view](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/69169/1403163/013f3bdc-3cef-11e3-9377-25427c4587fb.gif)

data.title: Release v32.0.0 not updating
data.body: I'm currently on v31.0. I clicked on the squirrel in the bottom right corner for the release notes. This told me to close and restart Atom to update. But after quitting, I'm still on v31. It'll be easy for me to grab it, but I thought I'd file this issue and not update in case it's a bug.

data.title: Get rid of ANSI escape sequences in Constructicon output
data.body: Passing --no-color to grunt should get rid of these.

data.title: Upgrade to less 1.5.0
data.body:
Less 1.5.0 does proper exports/requires now so we no longer need our fork with [this fix](https://github.com/nathansobo/less.js/commit/6c666c22aa22b2a9118db4adbd19c25376e24d0a).

Closes #751

data.title: Some native npm packages don't build on Windows
data.body:
This is a roll-up bug to track packages that don't build in Windows right now:
- [x] atom/node-pathwatcher#2
- [x] atom/git-utils#8
- [ ] Roll new versions of packages

data.title: Pressing Option-Left/Right flashes Movement menu item
data.body: Navigating a line of text by word, flashes the Movement menu in blue for every key press. This is super distracting, as I lose focus on text editing and my eyes wander up to the menu bar.

data.title: Second pass on sublime text keybindings
data.body: We almost have parity with the common keybindings, let's clean the rest up.

data.title: Revisit the package creation doc/example
data.body:
A lot of things have moved around or been added. The [creating a package](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/creating-a-package.md) doc is out of date. I want it to reflect best practices:
- explain how to use the package generator straight away
- reference using the [styleguide](https://github.com/atom/styleguide)
- use a variable out of `ui-variables.less` 
- explain a bit about the philospohy around using stylesheets
- mention dev-live-reload
- maybe some pictures of the example package
- a TOC so I know there is an example section

data.title: Remove `_.nextTick` from atom exports
data.body: This has been deprecated and I've now removed it. If you're currently using `{_} = require 'atom'` and then calling `_.nextTick` you should use node's `setImmediate` instead.

data.title: Atom settings set using the UI are not saved.
data.body:
1. Toggle Autosave under Core Settings.
2. In the console verify that `config.get('core.autosave')` is not being toggled.
## What should happen

`config.get('core.autosave')` should reflect the state of the UI.

data.title: Update packages to use new language-* package naming scheme
data.body:
Follow on to #1012 

Remove the package activation shim and update all the packages that were previously activating packages using the `*-tmbundle` scheme.

data.title: Add visual cues for errors and beeps
data.body: This makes Space Pen's `flashError` method functional again and adds an option for a `visual beep`

data.title: More detailed pass at API documentation
data.body: This is another pass at documenting our public API. I'm going to focus on what's directly exported via `require 'atom'`

data.title: Add branch selector as dependency
data.body:
This is just something for your consideration; I finished the [branch-selector](https://github.com/atom/branch-selector) package a while back. Might be nice to add into core but I won't be :broken_heart: if it isn't.

Fixes #302.

I don't like the placement of the `SelectList` dialog, but if you look at other "status bar select lists" (_e.g._ the grammar selector), this is the only place you can put it. It'd be nice to be able to style it like a twipsy, giving it an anchor and a location.

/cc @kevinsawicki @mattgraham 

![screen shot 2013-10-21 at 2 34 55 pm](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/64050/1376674/f0d65594-3a98-11e3-8c21-8764a765dd83.png)

data.title: Insert cursor should always stay in view while typing
data.body:
### Expected

While typing a line that extends beyond the viewable area, the view will continually shift to keep the insert cursor in view.
### Actual

Cursor will type its way off the page, making it impossible to see what's being typed without manually scrolling the view.

data.title: Jump to first non-whitespace character
data.body: I'll file this under "nice to have" but I love in sublime how when I hit `⌘` + `←`, it jumps to the first non-whitespace character, rather than all the way to the beginning of the line. I rarely want to be all the way to the left of my indents.

data.title: Every clicked file opens
data.body: I imagine this is by design, but it's annoying that every file in the tree that I click gets opened. Being trained on Sublime where you can click view a file without "opening" it, in Atom I tend to end up with a million open tabs just because I'm trying to find something. It'd be nice if a file clicked on only opens if a change is made, or if I double click on it or something.

data.title: Too many button states on the tree
data.body:
![screen shot 2013-10-21 at 10 57 07 am](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/72919/1374992/42a6663a-3a7a-11e3-8c20-b9c2af154370.png)

This has been driving me crazy. There are so many different states that I have to actively stop and think about what I'm doing to find files. I :heart: the way sublime handles it with just 2 states, and the difference is barely noticeable. Since we have the concept of edited files, we'll probably need another state, but I think we could do it in a way more subtle way.

data.title: Add some security precautions to package installation
data.body:
- [ ] When installing a package, display a warning dialog that describes how packages have the capability of being malicious.
- [x] Link GitHub identities closely with packages (will be easy because everything in the package store will be hosted on GitHub.)
- [x] Ability to flag package as malicious and convey this message to users who have installed package.
- [ ] **Possibly** Log I/O, shelling, keychain access, etc... so people can see what is going on without their knowledge.

data.title: Install packages from atom.io
data.body:
- [x] Add new `packageDependencies` field to `package.json`
- [x] Publish packages to atom.io
- [x] Publish converted TextMate bundles to atom.io
- [x] Upgrade APM
- [x] :copyright::information_source:  is :green_apple: 

Closes #912
### What's changed
- If you are adding a new Atom package as a dependency it now goes in `packageDependencies` instead of `dependencies`
- You need to have a keychain token or `ATOM_ACCESS_TOKEN` set now to bootstrap packages from atom.io (similar to how atom-shell downloads work).
- Bundled Textmate bundles have been converted and pushed to new repos using the `language-*` naming convention.
- `apm publish minor` now automatically pushes the tag (and `HEAD`)

data.title: Do not always use "/tmp" to represent system temporary directory
data.body:
On OS X there are two kinds of temporary directories: `/tmp` and `process.env.TMPDIR`, the latter is the one returned by `os.tmpdir()` or `temp.dir`, and doesn't have a permanent path. In this PR the `/tmp` is used for storing various caches, and `temp.dir` is used for storing temporary files.

On Windows we just use `temp.dir` for everything.
